results.title: Bertolt Brecht's Galileo = Galileo
results.creator_credit: Joseph Losey, Ely Landau, Cinevision Ltee and The Ely Landau Organization
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
From the American Film Theatre series of the 1970s comes the adaptation of the Bertolt Brecht play “Galileo”. Adapted for the screen by Barbara Bray and Joseph Losey from the English version by Charles Laughton. An all star cast tell the tale of 1600’s astronomer and scientist Galileo (Topol), his struggle with authorities and being ostracised - something which writer Brecht could identify having left Hollywood in 1947 to avoid having to testify before the House Un-American Activities Committee. Galileo comes up with the notion that the Earth revolves around the Sun - and desires astronomy become the much talked about subject of his era. He finds out about the telescope presents it as his invention to the Republic of Venice. The Papal astronomer then confirms Galileo’s discoveries much to the chagrin of the theologians of the church. So, for eight years he remained silent on his discoveries. Galileo then becomes a prisoner of the Inquisition until his death. Linking the scenes throughout are songs sung by a trio of choir boys and written captions that move the narrative through time to significant events in Galileo’s life. Cast includes Tom Conti, John Gielgud, Edward Fox, Colin Blakely, Georgia Brown, Margaret Leighton, Michael Lonsdale, Patrick Magee, John McEnery, Clive Revill.

results.title: The Man in the glass booth
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hiller, Ely Landau, Ely Landau Organization and Cinevision Ltee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
Searing adaptation made for the American Film Theatre collection, of the Robert Shaw play, about a wealthy Jewish man living in Manhattan who is beset by demons and paranoia. A survivor of the Holocaust, Arthur Goldman is one day kidnapped and shipped to Israel where he is tried for war crimes. But is this character the victim or the perpetrator? With its claustrophobic and minimalist setting, Arthur Hiller teases out the themes of guilt, paranoia, conspiracy theories and martyrdom. Maximillian Schell was nominated for an Academy Award for his portrayal of Goldman, but the adaptation itself was controversial, with Shaw removing his name from the credits, due to dissatisfaction with Edward Anhalt’s screenplay.

results.title: Loveproof
results.creator_credit: Maia Horniak, Katherine Shortland and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
In the late 21st century the world is stricken with chemical warfare and a declining population. A soldier brings his new love, a displaced migrant, back to his utopian home only to discover that they will have to resort to extreme measures to stay together. A modern-day fable about displacement, sacrifice and love.
Cast includes Alex Dimitriades, Lewis Fitz-Gerald.

results.title: Look sharp
results.creator_credit: Amy Gebhardt, Ben Commens and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
After spending a drunken night together, Jo, a photographer, is compelled to capture the emotional truth beneath the rough exteriors of Sharpie gang members, Darren and Jason. But to what lengths will she go in the name of art?
Inspired by the art of Nan Goldin, Diane Arbus and Carol Jerrems, Look Sharp is a gripping one-scene psychological drama set in 1970s Melbourne.

results.title: Philadelphia, here I come!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
Donald McCann plays a young man Gar, bored with the monotony of his life in rural Ireland, who seeks adventure in the wider world by deciding to live with his aunt in Philadelphia. On the eve of his departure Gar reflects upon his past, on what might have been and upon his relationship with his emotionally distant father. His inner turmoil and rage are relayed via his alter ego (played by Des Cave) who gives a caustic running commentary about Gar’s shortcomings and those of his friends and family. A funny and bittersweet adaptation of the Brian Friel play of the same name, the narrative is a rumination upon identity, nationality, maturity and regret. Cast also includes: Siobhan McKenna and Eamon A. Kelly.

results.title: Danya
results.creator_credit: Beth Armstrong, Luke Eve and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Danya is the story of a troubled 8-year old who is determined to find out about her late mother but her repressed father is unable to reach out to her. An elderly Bulgarian woman provides a bridge. Set in neighbouring terrace houses in an autumnal Sydney, Danya considers how three generations deal with death.

results.title: The Maids
results.creator_credit: Christopher Miles, Robert Enders, Cinevision Ltee and Ely Landau Organization
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
Adapted from French playwright, Jean Genet’s absurdist play, “The Maids” is about a pair of sisters caught up in a twisted play-acting game whereby their antipathy for their mistress and for each other, is revealed. After having her husband framed and imprisoned, the sisters, employed as maids for Madame, plan to poison her. In her temporary absence however they fantasise about dominance, wealth and power with Claire (Susannah York) acting as Madame, whilst Solange (Glenda Jackson) alternately fawns over then rants mercilessly, spitting out endless bile that speaks of her own self-loathing and hatred for her class. The film presents an impressive, and appropriate, sense of claustrophobia as the two women steer along a tragic course. Stellar cast also includes Vivien Merchant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Miles, Robert Enders, Cinevision Ltee and Ely Landau Organization

results.title: Crooked Mick of the Speewah
results.creator_credit: Philip Smith, Luke Eve and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Strong-Arm Sam and his promoter Gus are down on their luck. Sick and tired of hearing about how much stronger Crooked Mick of the Speewah is, they decide to travel to the Speewah and challenge him.
Cast includes Bruce Spence. Based on a short story by Pat Edwards.

results.title: Boys Grammar
results.creator_credit: Rozlyn Clayton-Vincent, Justin Davies, Dean Francis and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Set in an exclusive boys school, Gareth learns that his feelings can be validated and expressed only through violence.
A graphic and disturbing look at the ritual of hazing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rozlyn Clayton-Vincent, Justin Davies, Dean Francis and AFTRS

results.title: Black berries
results.creator_credit: Ema Mulholland, Rosie Travers and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Black Berries is a story about Candy and Lao, two 12 year old best friends. One fateful day while walking home, the girls come to a laneway - the short cut. Lao begins to walk down it but, in a moment of loyalty, Candy keeps a promise she made to her mother and chooses the long way home.
Cast includes Anne Louise Lambert.
